result.execSummary:
The defendant Keiona Ann Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Provide DNA Sample and pay all appropriate costs.  
Pay all costs and surcharges and Supervision fees.   
Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment and/ or school and/ or vocational training.
As a convicted felon, defendant may never possess a firearm or body armor and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Mental Health evaluation and take all prescribed medications.

Participate in AODA assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.   
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY;  random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keiona Ann Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court vacated the warrant.

Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court with attorney Cynthia M. Wynn.  Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Statements made as to sentencing. 
COUNT 1 & 2  - CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER:
Defendant sentenced to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for sentencing, in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
Discharge Summary, from JusticePoint, received and filed. lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Violation report from JusticePoint, received and filed. lms

Defense counsel is out ill and defendant has family emergency.   Case is adjourned for a PLEA AND SENTENCING in branch 6.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Cases are transferred to br. 6 for global resolution.  lms
Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court with attorney Caitlin H Firer.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant picked up new charges. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court with attorney Cynthia Wynn for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/25/14.

14RM015642  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-18-14

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Keiona Ann Brown in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
